intro: Xylosteon utahensis, commonly known as the Utah stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Utah. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, enabling it to survive in dry environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a hardy addition to rock gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
